page.title: 17FARMING CONTINUED
page.content: The cows are milked at 6.00a.m. and 3.00p.m. In the not to distant past this would have been done by hand, but nowadays there is a machine which can milk up to 10 cows at a time.After each session it has to be thoroughly rinsed through with steam. The crops that are grown on the farm are barley, maize and wheat. The maize is used for animal food. The wheat is sold to be made into bread and biscuits. The barley is taken to Shoreham Harbour to be shipped to West Germany where it is used in the brewing of beer.
